titleStmt.title: News from Yorke being a true relation of all the severall occurrences there this last weeke. Wherein is expressed, how His Majesty hath put seventeene iustices out of commission, and sent out warrants for the gentry of Yorkshire to bring in many horse, or money to provide horse, for three moneths. With other remarkable things. / Written from a gentleman at Yorke, to his speciall friend at London. July 1. 1642.
titleStmt.author: Gentleman at Yorke.

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
